Important Articles.headline: PDD Holdings (NasdaqGS:PDD) recently announced impressive Q4 earnings, reporting a rise in sales to CNY 110,610 million and net income increasing to CNY 27,447 million compared to the previous year. The company's basic and diluted EPS also improved, marking strong profitability. This robust financial performance likely played a significant role in the company's stock price climbing 25% over the last quarter. Despite a broader market environment struggling to maintain a rebound, with major...
Important Articles.title: PDD Holdings (NasdaqGS:PDD) Reports Q4 Sales Growth To ¥110 Billion And Net Income Rising To ¥27 Billion

Important Articles.headline: The Nasdaq Composite (NASDAQINDEX: ^IXIC) recently dipped into correction territory, defined as falling at least 10% from recent highs.  There are several growing companies offering solid value that could lead to outstanding returns from this point.  Here are two reasonably valued growth stocks that could be worth a lot more in 10 years than they are today.
Important Articles.title: Nasdaq Correction: 2 Winning Stocks on Sale Right Now

Important Articles.title: PDD Holdings (PDD): One of the Best Foreign Stocks to Buy According to Billionaires

Important Articles.headline: PDD Holdings, which operates e-commerce platforms Pinduoduo and Temu, missed market estimates for quarterly revenue on Thursday, as demand remained weak in China despite deep discounts and government stimulus to boost spending.  While government stimulus measures and deep price cuts from retailers have drawn some shoppers, PDD's sales report indicates persistent weakness in the Chinese economy is still forcing consumers to keep a tight lid on their spending.  The company is also facing stiff competition from e-commerce industry leaders Alibaba and JD.com, with both reporting better-than-expected revenues in recent weeks.
Important Articles.title: Temu-owner PDD Holdings' revenues hit by intense China competition and challenges abroad

Important Articles.headline: As part of today's Market Minute, Madison Mills outlines the top stories of the trading day. Intel (INTC) stock plunges as US–China trade war tensions intensify. Dell Technologies (DELL) stock extends losses as Morgan Stanley (MS) analysts raise concerns about tariff impacts. Chinese tech stocks, like Alibaba (BABA), PDD Holdings (PDD), and JD.com (JD), tumble as China retaliates against Trump's new tariffs. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
Important Articles.title: Intel, Dell, Chinese tech stocks fall: Market Minute
